alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 4:14PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Deaf Smith County through 500 PM CDT... At 414 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Bellview, or 26 miles northwest of Friona, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Deaf Smith County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
